topic.title: PSA Regarding Flight Sim Labs, Ltd products.
topic.body:
If you use any of Flight Sim Labs, Ltd's software, be aware that they are hijacking passwords from software users.

topic.title: Zeronet Seedbox Owners, BigFiles auto Seed size limit fixed.
topic.body:
For those who have zeronet seedboxes that are left on 24/7,. As of v3465 the BigFiles file size limit bug has been fixed and will now adhere to the set file size limits.

No more overfilled HDD/SSD's -cheers.
I once again enabled my box to auto seed files of <12mb on ZeroUp & <22mb on kopyKat

topic.title: BayFiles has been reborn.
topic.body:

Non registered accounts have an upload limit of 10GB per file and membership accounts are given a 1TB storage allotment for about 3.5 and 5 euro per month.

1511856741_17ffrcHNzbFoUe81PyMEagQdv2DGN.body:
Here are a few of my suggestions that I feel are missing 
  
 - Star rating systems & the ability to sort by average rating (no start to 5 starts)  
 - Category Assignment (News, Entertainment, Trailers, etc)  
 - Search tags (politics, movie, etc)  
 - No Seeds Exclusion Option (An Check box option to exclude any listings that have peers but no seeds and would result in long play delay)  
 - Length ID and an ability to sort by video length (So I can separate documentaries & shows from short clips)  
 - It would be great if users could share a url that pulls a search result. For instance if I search for Mr Robot, it would be great if I could get a URL
- Assigning videos to 'Favorites' Lists, Being able to share or browse a catalog of people's favorite list / playlists
- An ability to 'mute' specific users without having to assign a global mute through ZeroID

I'll come back and add more when I think of them. Keep up the awesomeness.
Since there isn't a subscribe feature yet, Can you add a feature to auto-download seed a video from users we trust?

> [styromaniac](#comment_131_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): I see lots of videos with 0/x peers.  

 I've noticed just because it says 0/0 doesn't mean it's not seeded or not accessible. It simply means that your client hasn't made any connections to the peers of that video so your client thinks it's 0/0.

Sometimes you can click a 0/0, wait a few seconds to a minute and the media will begin to play.

1513048648_17ffrcHNzbFoUe81PyMEagQdv2DGN.body: I've noticed that too. My pi get's about 400 - 600 on Play alone depending on the time of day. Sometimes I wonder if there are more as the proxy reports in the thousands and that a node like mine or the proxy doesn't connect to every peer and there are more that remain unconnected directly to me (as there are enough connected to propagate a change) or there is a bug in the peers reported to serve the page. Just my observation. I could swear I remember nofish saying a node doesn't connect to all peers available as a means of security, but I could be wrong.

as of right now the peers are about similar between the two nodes, on play the proxy shows ~95 more peers than my pi shows which is expected for this time of day to me.  
  
But look at that... I see 0porn having ~1000 peers which I don't have seeded. So it makes me wonder how many more hidden peers there are. Those who don't seed play or any of those front pages.

1514422899_1FzZsDQdh8wk71bDLxURPzmAt2FXe.body:
1 Nobody is likely to seed an empty or blank page site. Maybe within the first 10 minutes until the user discovers how to delete them.  
  2 If you pull the top right '0' button to the left, you can see specifics about a site including the size, and file types being pictures, etc. If a blank site is using 5MB and shows unlisted images, this should peek a concern.  
  
There's a general rule that should be followed with any network platform and that is to be aware of what you are connected to and sharing. If the visitor feels a site could later be untrustworthy, it is to that user's discretion to continue to seed that site.  
  
But more importantly new sites are created & die all the time on Zeronet. Random one time users clone blogs & other sites, add one entry, and then never visit it again. If this was done with ever site visited the main page populated list would be so cluttered with garbage that I would be amazed if a user didn't clean it all with a single directory wipe.  
  
Precautions has to be taken on the clearnet to avoid malicious sites that would hijack your PC. Why would anyone expect these same surfing precautions not be applied to Zeronet sites as well?  
  
The unaware will be exploited, regardless of the environment.
Also let's not forget that sites that aren't visited often but want to be kept can be placed in a 'Paused' status where it will not receive any questionable updates.

On the main page a user is able to click [FILES] and see all data held within their Zeronet folder. It's healthy to do a precautionary scan of this media to ensure your own safety. IMO, Zeronet should not take explicit measures beyond formal education & awareness.  

  - Sort files by seeds and check files that have low seed counts.
  - Check files that have names like sex.jpg, fuckTALK.png, ScrewU.pdf etc to ensure nothing questionable or simply delete them.
  - Don't join questionable sites with an exposed IP.
  - Do research on a site and see if there are any discussions about it.

While I don't like them either, the measures used to block/ban/censor/silence the voice of one group can be easily used for all others. (Block the transgender, political dissent, copyright infringement, unorthodox religions (Scientology, Satanism, Kopimism) sites while your attempting to block the pedo sites. It always has resulted to this and it always will.

The hands that guide you can easily become the hands that bind you. Do you fear for the clearnet user who may stumble upon a propaganda site like the Fox Network? No, one expects them to have a certain level of awareness regarding the information they are about to consume.   Otherwise they are simply dinner for the next wolf on the prowl.

> [ixhb5a7vwvdgimjx](#comment_5_18fLf6bqfzvGLvMA2DrEmDxiqvnAWyN6dv): ZeroNet needs users and content to thrive, but above all it needs them to be running their own clients for the concept to work at all.  
  
Couldn't agree more, but many wouldn't peek an interest until they glimpsed a sight of what they were missing. I would like to think of it as similar to the slow growth of the TOR network. Users didn't start running the client until they seen browser addons and clearnet proxies that enabled them to test the waters of those darker sites. Or they had a need to do so as their favorite site getting taking down or moving to more resistant network.

> [ixhb5a7vwvdgimjx](#comment_6_18fLf6bqfzvGLvMA2DrEmDxiqvnAWyN6dv): "Zite owners would have to come up with a way of implementing code that stops their zites from being displayed on proxies that do not provide them a good deal." Now consider putting "127.0.0.1" in that list.
  
While such a thing does sound dreadful, we have to be open minded and consider that may be one part of ZeroNet's future evolution. Restricting such a site in such a way wouldn't be far off the realm of a private zite that uses a password prompt or userKey to provide access.  
  
Last I checked, private zites were a planned feature.

> [ixhb5a7vwvdgimjx](#comment_8_18fLf6bqfzvGLvMA2DrEmDxiqvnAWyN6dv): If it is, then it's a future many would like to opt out of. We didn't come here to ask for even more centralization. [...]

1514979229_1CrDG9mz8ziWTFyQ3ZQMBFfMAHs2R.body:
The rules of quantum physics allows all possible forms of information to be replicated & transformed. Of course the percentage of this reality becoming the observer's reality is wide to slim, but mathematics shows that a probability is not a 0% outcome.  
  
For this reason time as we know it is not 'flowing' but rather our existence lives out a specific frame and sequence of events. Like choosing a film reel that has multiple endings. (Every ending imaginable is already possible, it's simply a chance of which one is chosen by the observer. But that doesn't mean that all of those other 'film reels' cease to exist. They are simply not observed.  
  
Of course the implications of this means that death is not an ending, but such recognition could have great consequences for the mentally ill prepared and if proven, humans would simply kill themselves hoping for a new start at another existence. 
  
But little are we aware that those alternate realities & existences could be worse than the one we are already experiencing and the only way to hope for a new 'better' reality is to sense some attraction to it like a long lost love or twin.  
  
But that's just my two cents. We are but small minnows trapped in a galactic fish tank living our lives oblivious to the true realities that lay beyond our reach in this current form. Such small minnow would perish before experiencing the perspective of an eagle.

Indeed many unexplainable things happen to us all the time, they are simply dismissed as something else.  
It reminds me of the Shaman and the explorers. A shaman was standing at the shoreline staring off into the distance. Some villagers walked up and asked what the shaman was staring at. The shaman asked the villagers. "Look into the distance, what do you see." The first villager stared and said it's a cloud, the second villager stared and said it was a mountain. The shaman said to the villagers "It is neither of those. Go tell the village to sharpen their spears, it's a floating city and it's heading right towards us."  
  
Point of the story, phenomena happen to us all the time, it just depends if the observer is willing to accept the reality they see instead of the reality they want it to be. Our brains are not built to comprehend things we do not understand nor open to realizations. The unknown is often rationalized to be what would otherwise be known.

1515044755_1P7ZF1U5tMb3BKzp6jxWzz37VqGg2.body:
I weighed nearly 250lbs before I finally had enough of it all and decided to have a lifestyle change. Well, more of a diet change and just being aware of what I eat.  
  
While I know I should exercise more, I have stopped smoking cigarettes, I stopped eating fast food and now eat home cooked meals all month, I also cut back on my carbonated drinks and drink much more water. Since this diet change I dropped my weight and I'm now stabilizing at 180-190lbs depending on what I eat that week. (pizza vs salads)  
  
Ever since my diet change my borderline diabetes symptoms have went away completely. I now eat some eggs and toast for my breakfast which helps wake me up, I eat a sandwich & fruit for lunch which doesn't make me tired. and I'll sometimes eat a home cooked hamburger or some other heavier meal with a salad for dinner.  
  
I've been doing this for 3 months now and just the smell of fast food grosses me out now because to me, it smells like body sweat when I can get some of my 90/10 beef and cook my own hamburger that will taste a ton better, won't  be full of grease & fat, and is a lot healthier for me.

1528064284_16HcyFK8526ZYJBKPpSDCbpJv6WWB.body:
For those who would like to create a private ZeroLSTN box, follow these steps

1. Visit the site on your box, add the merger sites.
2. From the [FILES] tab from the main ZeroHello page Scroll down until you see the Merger sites labeled by year and click the down arrow and place a check on 'Help distribute all new files.'
3. Now click on the Merger site title to load up the blank white page that tells you to use ZeroLSTN, pull open right side panel Look for a 'Auto Download Big FIle size limit' with a value of  1MB and change it to (see below@AA), and click 'SET'.
4. Preform a 'Check Files' action on that merger site. All audios of that year will begin to download and be readily available on your box.
5. Repeat for other year merger sites.

Enjoy!

{AA}
~10 MB - Will grab about half of the mp3s hosted.
~20 MB - Will grab almost all of the mp3s hosted
~30 MB - Will grab almost all mp3s and flac hosted
~50 MB - Will grab just about everything.

1530712796_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
Zeronet is inherently deep net because a client is needed to access the otherwise inaccessible network. Sure a clearnet proxy can be served but the proxy is still using a zeronet client to communicate with the zeronet network making it 'deep' in sense that the information can not be accessed through conventional internet means.

Zeronet is inherently dark net because new sites created are not reported to a indexing service upon creation. Since each zeronet site is a bitcoin wallet address, attempting to discover sites through random addressing is impractical. With the regular internet, when creating a domain name it is reported to one or more indexing services like ICANN for the sole purpose of public discovery.

Terminology is everything and a network does not need to be scary simply because it is dark and deep. The fact that zeronet uses token or mesh topology is not related to it being either of the two.

1566051166_17dcwh1uMFnDMZK8X5XHciXFggdxV.body:
When looking at your user files it appears that your prior post was removed from your user's data.json file. This can happen from multiple reasons.

Situation 1:
You tampered / altered your '\data\1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT\data\users\17dcwh1uMFnDMZK8X5XHciXFggdxVXqfSD\data.json file, removed the comment data, and then made a post to resign the new alterations. (such as removing the old data and then making this comment to sign the altered file with the prior topic removed)

Situation 2: 
You were using two instances of the Zeronet folder, you made a comment with one instance and either it didn't propagate or it did and your second instance didn't update before posting a comment with your second instance which would overwrite your first comment with your first instance.

Other Occurrences:
This can also happen when posting a comment with a shared ZeroID such as the anonymous ones going around. If two users post at the same time with that ID, it is likely one comment will be overwritten by the other due to the zeronet network not being able to sync fast enough to preserve both changes.

In Summary:
Only the developer of the site (nofish in this instance) can remove your comment but even then, it would be just a cosmetic block and your user data in your user folder (that is shared with everyone) would still contain the information you posted, which it doesn't. I just checked.
